violations.message: Entity 'Project' does not have a version field for optimistic locking. Consider adding @Version to prevent concurrent modification issues.
Relationship 'teamMembers' in Project uses foreign key column(s). Ensure database indexes are created on foreign key columns for better query performance.

Relationship 'teamMembers' in Project is a collection mapping that could return many objects. Consider implementing pagination (@BatchFetch, @FetchJoin, or query limits) to avoid loading too many objects into memory.
Entity 'Project' does not have a @Version field. Consider adding optimistic locking support for concurrent updates.
Collection relationship 'teamMembers' in entity 'Project' does not use batch fetching. Consider adding @BatchFetch to optimize N+1 queries.
Lazy collection 'teamMembers' does not use batch fetching. This will cause N+1 queries when accessing the collection.
Lazy collection 'teamMembers' in entity 'Project' causes N+1 queries when accessed. Add @BatchFetch or use JOIN FETCH in queries.
ManyToMany relationship 'teamMembers' uses join table. Add indexes on both foreign key columns in the join table.
Entity 'Employee' does not have a version field for optimistic locking. Consider adding @Version to prevent concurrent modification issues.

Entity 'Employee' does not have a @Version field. Consider adding optimistic locking support for concurrent updates.
Collection relationship 'projects' in entity 'Employee' does not use batch fetching. Consider adding @BatchFetch to optimize N+1 queries.
Lazy collection 'projects' does not use batch fetching. This will cause N+1 queries when accessing the collection.

Bidirectional lazy collection 'projects' is accessed from both sides. Ensure both sides use consistent fetch strategies to avoid N+1 queries.
Bidirectional relationship 'projects' has inverse side mapped by 'teamMembers'. Ensure both sides have appropriate indexes.

Entity 'Project' is part of a cyclic dependency. Cycles can cause issues with serialization, transaction boundaries, and object loading. Consider breaking the cycle or using @XmlIDREF/@JsonManagedReference/@JsonBackReference annotations.

Entity 'Employee' is part of a cyclic dependency. Cycles can cause issues with serialization, transaction boundaries, and object loading. Consider breaking the cycle or using @XmlIDREF/@JsonManagedReference/@JsonBackReference annotations.
No root entities found (all entities have incoming relationships). This may indicate a circular model with no clear entry points.
No leaf entities found (all entities have outgoing relationships). This may indicate a highly interconnected model.
